conclusion: A is moving from the lower right towards the group of blocks with enough momentum to reach the blocks.
The first block A is likely to hit is the red block, as it is closest to its initial path.
After hitting the red block, A will likely be deflected and could move towards the green block next to the red one.

After the second collision, A could head towards the orange or blue blocks, depending on the direction it was deflected.
A might collide with one of the orange or blue blocks, further changing its path.
A will eventually stop after losing momentum from multiple collisions, likely within the cluster of blocks.
A will come to rest near the last block it collided with, most likely near the red or green block.

Final Answer: A will collide with the red block first, then potentially the green block, and possibly an orange or blue block. It will eventually stop within the cluster of blocks, most likely near the red or green block.
